PerfectNetExp.abs: splashed or covered patchily with moonlight ., 以斑点形式撒满或覆盖着月光的.

list.abs: covered patchily ; often used in combination ., 以斑点形式覆盖的 ; 常用于复合词.

auth_sentence.content: The choreography is patchily successful, but the dancers absolutely shine.
auth_sentence.res_content: The choreography is patchily successful, but the dancers absolutely shine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The choreography is patchily successful, but the dancers absolutely shine.

auth_sentence.content: He appeared to be in his late sixties or early seventies; his hair and beard, both patchily grayed, were bushy.
auth_sentence.res_content: He appeared to be in his late sixties or early seventies; his hair and beard, both patchily grayed, were bushy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He appeared to be in his late sixties or early seventies; his hair and beard, both patchily grayed, were bushy.

auth_sentence.content: The latter were slow, patchily colored, textured and extreme, both hot and cold.
auth_sentence.res_content: The latter were slow, patchily colored, textured and extreme, both hot and cold.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The latter were slow, patchily colored, textured and extreme, both hot and cold.
